result.execSummary:
The defendant Chaze Desouva Biami was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection. DOC to collect those monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of funds.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obtain GED.
Seek and maintain employment.
Court advises the defendant he cannot possess firearms or body armor

No violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause. 
Do not engage in any physical discipline of a child.

Provide a DNA sample if not previously provided and pay the DNA surcharge.
Cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.
Pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution.
Restitution set at 0.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chaze Desouva Biami

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Order as to Count 1 signed and filed.  Copies mailed to defendant and State./ds
records.descr: Petition for sentence adjust denied-public interst

records.addlTxt: Per order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Daniel L. Konkol, Br. 44, for review. mag
from Chaze Biami received and filed.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.   rmm

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay the surcharge - if not already done
-  DOC to collect those monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of funds;
- restitution set at -0-.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Defendant Chaze Desouva Biami in court with attorney Matt Last.  Defendant Chaze Desouva Biami in custody.  Matthew J. Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Deputy Clerk;ds

Case transferred from Br. 40 forthwith for sentencing.  Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by counsel, Pamela J., K.B. and defendant. COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms or body armor, he must provide a DNA sample if not previously provided and pay the DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 24 months with 148 days credit -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 12 months  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 12 months; pay costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  1) no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution; 3) do not engage in any physical discipline of a child; 4) obtain GED; 5) seek and maintain employment.

AS TO THE CHARGE AS AMENDED:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Chaze Desouva Biami in court with attorney Matt Last.  Michael C Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered penalty enhancer, Repeater, dismissed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Chaze Desouva Biami in court with attorney Matt Last.  Defendant Chaze Desouva Biami in custody.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court having been advised that witness, Zirria B. had been subpoenaed and served.  Court ordered that a bench warrant be issued for the defaulting witness.   COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.   Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Jury trial scheduled for July 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Chaze Desouva Biami in court with attorney Matt E Last.  Defendant Chaze Desouva Biami in custody.  Matthew J Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 6/30/14 in Branch 40.  State withdrew their offer to the defendant.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail $1500.00

Defendant Chaze Desouva Biami in court with attorney Matt Last.  Defendant Chaze Desouva Biami in custody.  Matthew J. Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING AND BREATHALYZER TESTS.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with K.B. (10/12/02).
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Chaze Desouva Biami in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Defendant Chaze Desouva Biami in custody.  Lucy J. Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DALLET, Branch 40.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 40.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
